required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Meal Replacement on Weight Loss Obesity Patients With Metabolic Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Meal Replacement on Weight Loss Obesity Patients With Metabolic Syndrome : A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether meal replacement, SlimWell Â®, is effective in the treatment of obesity patients with metabolic syndrome.

detailed_description.textblock:
The participants are divided into two groups: intervention group and control group. In the intervention group, the participants receive a meal replacement plus life style modification. In the control group, the participants receive only life style modification.
Sample size calculation is 69 participants per group. Primary outcome is to compare the weight loss between the intervention group and control group.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with weight loss unit in kilograms
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline body weight at 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with waist circumference change in centimeters
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline waist circumference at 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with triglyceride change in mg/dl.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline triglyceride at 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Grade 3 Through Grade 5 Adverse Events That Are Related to Study meal replacement, Graded According to NCI CTCAE Version 3.0
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Patients With Grade 3 Through Grade 5 Adverse Events That Are Related to Study meal replacement, Graded According to NCI CTCAE Version 3.0 focus on Gastrointestinal side effects.

arm_group.description: the participants receive a meal replacement plus life style modification
the participants receive life style modification only.

intervention.description: The participants will receive SlimWell 60 grams per meal for 2 meals per day plus life style modification including educational sessions of exercise, dietary intake, food record. The duration is 3 months.
The participants will receive only life style modification including educational sessions of exercise, dietary intake, food record. The duration is 3 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index more than or equal to 25 kg/m2
- Patients with metabolic syndrome
- Patients who are on anti-hypertensive drugs, oral hypoglycemic drugs and lipid lowering drugs.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled diabetes patients
- Patients with gastrointestinal abnormalities
- Patients with cardiovascular diseases
- Patients with hematologic disorders
- Patients with Glomerular filtration rate less than 60 ml/min/1.73m2
- Patients with drug or alcohol abuse
- Pregnancy and lactation

facility.name: Faculty of Medicine Siriraj Hospital, Mahidol University

reference.citation: Leader NJ, Ryan L, Molyneaux L, Yue DK. How best to use partial meal replacement in managing overweight or obese patients with poorly controlled type 2 diabetes. Obesity (Silver Spring). 2013 Feb;21(2):251-3. doi: 10.1002/oby.20057.
